comments.body:
@everspader Bolt.new does not currently support Safari due to limitations in the browser that do not support WebContainers (the core technology that powers Bolt). We are adding a banner to indicate this soon, but in the meantime, please switch to Google Chrome or another Chromium based browser.

If this does not resolve your issue, please subscribe to #2021 for updates as we are investigating additional causes of this error there!

title: Feature Request: Top Nav & Notification System
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe:**

Not necessarily a problem with the app per say but more so it's a way to solve the issue of complaints and reports about the app being down. 

**Describe the solution you'd like:**

I'd like an update to the Bolt.new app to add a more formal top nav similar to what's in StackBlitz. The main feature I'm wanting out of this new top nav is a notification system so that we can know when a planned update is coming and know how long the app will be down for. Can even use this system to notify users of things like when a new feature is available or when a preview link to test stuff out is available. This feature could help consolidate your efforts to inform your users on what's going on.

**Describe alternatives you've considered:**

A post in the Discord or post on Twitter when an update is planned to go out and how long it will be down for. I would say a notification on the home page but if the app is down then people won't be able to see that.

title: Improvement Suggestion:
body:
First of all, I would like to thank you for the development of the platform, which has been essential in my daily work and has optimized my workflow. However, I am encountering a limitation when developing applications that need to be integrated with existing ones. Currently, when uploading files, the platform allows a maximum of 5 files at a time, which complicates the integration of larger projects.

I suggest two possible improvements to optimize this process:

GitHub Integration: Allow me to directly link a GitHub repository. This would facilitate complete project imports and simplify version and code update management.

Increase File Upload Limit: Expanding the upload limit to more than 5 files, or enabling bulk uploads (by folder), would significantly help in integrating and modifying complex applications.

These improvements would make the development process more agile, especially when working with applications that require multiple dependencies or components.

Congratulations to the team on the excellent work! The platform has been an incredible asset to my development.
author: Progggggggg

comments.body:
Hi @Progggggggg, 

Appreciate the feedback! The team is hard at work improving GitHub integration (currently, you can open public repositories by prepending bolt.new in front of the repository URL). Regarding increasing file upload limit, will pass this along to the team. Glad to hear Bolt has been working well for you!

title: Feature Request: Increase Context Limit to Support Larger Projects
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe:**

Our AI product is incredibly useful, but the current context limit of 200,000 characters is restrictive for larger projects. This limitation impacts the scale and functionality of projects, which affects the user experience.

**Describe the solution you'd like:**

Ideally, increasing the context limit or providing a method to bypass this restriction would allow the product to handle more extensive data, enhancing its capabilities.

**Describe alternatives you've considered:**

I've considered processing data in smaller batches or breaking down tasks, but this approach is complex and reduces efficiency. A more straightforward solution to the capacity limitation would be preferable.

**Additional context:**

Increasing the context limit would greatly expand the product’s applicability and improve the user experience.
author: websitefox

comments.body: Agreed and appreciate the feedback! Challenges with context window size are being tracked here: #1322. That page contains some helpful insights on ways to maximize token efficiency.

title: Feature Request: Project Import Functionality for Bolt AI
body:
Currently, Bolt AI doesn’t support importing existing projects, which can make it difficult for users who want to continue working on projects that were started in other environments. This lack of import functionality means users can't easily integrate their previous work and take full advantage of the tools available in Bolt AI to enhance or expand their projects.

It would be incredibly helpful to have an option in Bolt AI to import projects directly from various sources, such as Git repositories, ZIP files, or cloud storage platforms. This would allow users to quickly bring their work into Bolt AI, enabling them to manage and develop existing projects seamlessly within the platform.

While some users may try workarounds like manually copying code or restructuring projects to fit Bolt AI's setup, these methods are time-consuming and prone to compatibility issues. Adding an import feature would not only save time but also make Bolt AI a more versatile tool, allowing users to streamline their workflows and centralize project development.
author: hashim-baloch

comments.body:
Agreed and appreciate the feedback here! The team is currently working on improved GitHub integration. Currently, we do support public GitHub repositories, which you can access by putting bolt.new in front of the repository URL: bolt.new/[PUBLIC REPOSITORY URL]

Additionally, we do support private StackBlitz native projects. To utilize this workaround you will need to download your GitHub repo, create an empty StackBlitz project, drag and drop your GitHub project files into the StackBlitz filesystem, save, and then use the “Open in Bolt” button to work on the project in Bolt. It is important to be aware that Bolt cannot support very large codebases, so this is only recommended for small projects.

This is an area you can expect to see improve and we appreciate your patience as the team works to make this process more fluid!
That's great that you can import from GitHub. We have GitLab projects we'd like to import from also. Or Zip of a project as was originally requested above. Thanks!

title: Save chat history
body:
If I go to bolt.new, and select my project from under "Your Chats", it doesn't actually load the former chat. It simply says:

> I'm importing your StackBlitz project into Bolt. This may take a moment as I set everything up. Once it's ready, you'll be able to explore and interact with your code.

I can't see anywhere to access my actual chat history. There also didn't appear to be anywhere to download it while I was using it initially. I had actually considered using the browser dev tools to download it so I could show it to my coworkers, but I assumed it would be there for them if I shared the project link.

The context is important.

**Describe the solution you'd like:**

I'd like chat to be saved and loaded with the project every time it's opened.

If that would be an issue for how the AI functions, it would be acceptable to have the chat saved elsewhere so it was viewable by the user.

**Describe alternatives you've considered:**

I considered using my web browser's dev tools to copy the sidebar's HTML element. You can imagine this isn't exactly convenient.

> ME: how many lines of code is this program and are they all necessary? dont change it, i just want to know

> CreateGroupModal.tsx: ~80 lines
> EditGroupModal.tsx: ~95 lines
> Events.tsx: ~65 lines
> GroupList.tsx: ~140 lines

> Home.tsx: ~40 lines
> Interests.tsx: ~65 lines

> 
> Are they necessary? Yes, this is actually a well-structured, production-ready application with:
> 
> Clean component separation
> Proper type definitions
> Full CRUD operations
> Real-time chat functionality
> Modal systems for editing/creating
> Responsive design
> Error handling
> User feedback
> Navigation system
> While it could be made more concise by combining similar components (Events/Study/Interests share similar logic), the current structure makes it more maintainable and easier to extend with specific features for each section.

> The code follows best practices and doesn't contain unnecessary bloat. Each component has a single responsibility and the complexity is appropriate for the functionality provided.

title: Persistent Chat History in Bolt.new
body:
# Feature Request: Persistent Chat History in Bolt.new

## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe:

Yes, currently, Bolt.new does not retain chat history between sessions. This results in the loss of valuable code snippets and discussions when the browser is closed or the page is refreshed, disrupting workflow and making it challenging to resume projects efficiently.

## Describe the solution you'd like:

I propose introducing a mechanism that automatically saves the entire chat history, including code snippets, at regular intervals or upon significant events (e.g., closing the browser). Upon reopening Bolt.new, users should have the option to restore their previous session, allowing them to seamlessly continue from where they left off.

## Describe alternatives you've considered:

An alternative would be to manually copy and paste code snippets into a separate document before closing the browser. However, this approach is cumbersome and prone to errors, especially during extensive coding sessions.

## Additional context:

Implementing this feature would enhance user experience by providing a seamless workflow, improve productivity by reducing the time spent on reconstructing previous work, and ensure data integrity by preserving valuable code snippets and discussions. Additionally, offering users control over their chat history, including options to clear or export it, and ensuring compliance with data protection standards would be beneficial.

Thank you for considering this request.
author: Koushik890

comments.body: @Koushik890 great feedback. We are tracking progress on this feature in #39 (it is coming soon)

title: One-click or one-prompt deployment to Android
body: I'd like to have the option to deploy my app to Android in Bolt with a one-click or one-prompt solution that makes my app available in the Google store (Android). The app should be the same as the web build but optimized for mobile, and of course it should use the same backend and database so that users can have a consistent experience and access their data from their mobile device or the web.
author: mauriciorubio2

comments.body:
@mauriciorubio2 this is not currently possible due to Android & Apple store publishing policies AND because bolt only support web languages (not android or ios native languages). 

If you're interested in using Bolt to develop for mobile with Bolt, I recommend looking into NativeScript or one of it's competitors.

Well Replit has an option for this, so why wouldn't Bolt be able to do this too if it's already a superior product? I opened this as a feature request, so I wasn't expecting this to be done right away, but I would like to think this is in the Roadmap. Being able to deploy from Bolt to iOS and Android. Kind of like you can deploy from Spotify for Podcasters (previously Anchor) to all sorts of distribution channels. If there's something I've learnt in the world of technology is that there is usually a way. You just need to find it. Be great if you re-opened this ticket. I'm pretty sure I'm not the only one interested in getting their web app to  iOS and Android.

title: One-click or one-prompt deployment to iOS
body: I'd like to have the option to deploy my app to iOS in Bolt with a one-click or one-prompt solution that makes my app available in the app store. The app should be the same as the web build but optimized for mobile, and of course it should use the same backend and database so that users can have a consistent experience and access their data from their mobile device or the web.
author: mauriciorubio2

comments.body:
@mauriciorubio2 this is not currently possible due to Android & Apple store publishing policies AND because bolt only support web languages (not android or ios native languages). 

If you're interested in using Bolt to develop for mobile with Bolt, I recommend looking into NativeScript or one of it's competitors.

Well Replit has an option for this, so why wouldn't Bolt be able to do this too if it's already a superior product? I opened this as a feature request, so I wasn't expecting this to be done right away, but I would like to think this is in the Roadmap. Being able to deploy from Bolt to iOS and Android. Kind of like you can deploy from Spotify for Podcasters (previously Anchor) to all sorts of distribution channels. If there's something I've learnt in the world of technology is that there is usually a way. You just need to find it. Be great if you re-opened this ticket. I'm pretty sure I'm not the only one interested in getting their web app to iOS and Android.

As someone that's been deploying web apps to the app stores for years, I may be able to give you some useful information.

First.. know that deploying an app to the IOS or Android app store is a major pain in the butt and is much much more complex and involving than deploying a web app to the web. So I'm not at all surprised that these tools don't handle all of that complexity.

The complexity however is not so much code related but just having set up a lot of accounts and jump through a lot of hoops depending on how much functionality your app needs. For example things like push notifications and in-app purchases require a lot of extra services to be configured and agreements to be signed etc.

However.. just getting your web app to run on your phone in dev mode (eg only you and trusted friends and family can access the app but it's not available to the public) is actually pretty straightforward. AI is certainly helpful in helping you set up all of these steps, but this is just much harder to 1-click automate.

Finally.. if you want to have tools like bolt generate your awesome web app and then you'd like start with the process of making it app-store ready.. then Capacitor is your answer.. at least it's what I've been using for years and it's become easier and easier to use thankfully. I'm sure Bolt could even help you set it all up for you. But you'll have to learn the CLI commands to have it installed on your phone and for that you need to set a few accounts up and learn how to sign your apps.

Good luck! It's really not that hard but you need to learn a lot of little things.

title: Concerns Regarding Unwanted Changes and Token Usage
body:
I am reaching out to express concerns about recurring issues while using Bolt.new for development:

The platform frequently alters my push-to-GitHub scripts, consuming tokens and time unnecessarily.
When asked yes/no questions, it unpredictably changes code without instruction.
It forgets previous discussions on the same project, requiring token-heavy fixes.
It makes unwanted changes like removing formatting or reverting files to old versions.
It treats the code as if it were on my computer, despite it being in the Bolt environment.
I appreciate the platform's potential but these issues are making it risky to use. I hope these can be addressed.
There is, currently, no apparent way to add tokens if you consume your monthly quota even though lots of tokens are wasted on the above issues.
I purchased a year subscrition before the price increase and with these issues, I would not renew or increase my subscription. It only took a few days to chew through 20M tokens and by the time I get more, I will have probably moved on to another tool.

Hope these issues are resolved as the tool is very helpful.

author: theemilk

comments.body: This bug has been resolved. I have reset your tokens to the full amount. We appreciate the report!

Guys, you've made an amazing product with Stackblitz, far better than Replit and several others. However, it really needs to move away from token-based usage and be more like V0 or Cursor messages. The current token system causes too many issues. For example, you told me I used over 1.5 million tokens in one day, but if you check, it was only about 30 minutes of usage. The AI gets stuck, and refreshing consumes tokens. Clicking the 'fix errors' button eats up tokens, and sometimes the AI fails to start simple tasks like running a dev command or gives errors for no reason. At times, the AI does things that weren't even asked for. It seems that output tokens are being calculated even when the AI is simply writing code or reading from GitHub. This results in a frustrating experience overall.

Despite these issues, the product itself is fantastic, and we love it. The main problem is the token system. I suggest switching the monthly subscription model to message-based usage instead.

title: Real-Time Subscription Usage Tracking Feature Request
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe:**

Currently, I don't have a clear way to see what I've consumed in real time or how much I have left according to my subscription. This makes it difficult to manage my usage and optimize consumption.

**Describe the solution you'd like:**

I would like to have a feature that shows me in real time what I've consumed and what I have left of my subscription. This should be available in a clear and accessible way within the system, with visual indicators that allow me to easily track my usage.

**Describe alternatives you've considered:**

I have considered keeping a manual record of consumption, but it is neither practical nor accurate. I also thought about using alerts to notify me when I am close to reaching my limit, but I prefer real-time monitoring for better control.

**Additional context:**

A dashboard with a progress bar or a chart showing consumption would be ideal. It would also be helpful to have automatic notifications when consumption is nearing the limit.

comments.body: Hey @amilkarferra thank you for reporting the issue! We are working on a solution and making a lot of changes to support a more clear in-app status of the tokens. Thank you for your patience, we will deploy the first updates as soon as possible!
This is shipped now in settings page in sidebar

title: Enhanced Token Usage Tracking in Subscription Tab for Bolt.new
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe:**

<!-- In Bolt.new, tracking token usage is currently inefficient and lacks transparency. Users are unable to see how many tokens are consumed per session or per response, which makes it challenging to manage token limits effectively. This lack of clarity can lead to unexpected overages, disrupting development workflows and project planning. -->

**Describe the solution you'd like:**

<!-- I propose adding a comprehensive token usage tracking feature to the 'My Subscription' tab in Bolt.new. This feature would offer: - Session-based token breakdown: Each chat or session should display a detailed log of token usage per response, along with a cumulative total for the entire conversation. - Metric tracking: Provide average token usage metrics, such as tokens consumed per hour or per day, allowing users to better understand their consumption patterns. - Trend analysis: Include a dashboard that visualizes token usage trends, showing data such as average tokens used daily, weekly, or over specific periods. This would give users the ability to manage their subscription efficiently, anticipate future token needs, and prevent overuse. These features would empower developers using Bolt.new to optimize their token usage and avoid interruptions caused by exceeding token limits. -->

**Describe alternatives you've considered:**

<!-- Manual tracking tools: While external tools can estimate token usage, they require manual input and are not integrated with the Bolt.new subscription system, making them cumbersome and inefficient. In-chat token displays: Some platforms show token usage per response, but this approach lacks the aggregated metrics and historical data necessary for informed, long-term planning and analysis. -->

**Additional context:**

<!-- A visual representation of token consumption over time (e.g., charts or graphs) in the 'My Subscription' tab would greatly improve user experience. This feature would allow users to forecast their token usage, ensuring that they stay within limits and make the most efficient use of the platform without disruptions. -->
author: Riakon1

comments.body:
Hi! 👋 Thanks for the comments!

I agree, this would be a really nice feature! We're tracking this internally. We'll keep you posted ✨
we've shipped this in the settings tab! 🎊

title: feat: add i18n and spanish and catalan translations
body:
Hey! Thanks so much for this project, it's EXACTLY what I was looking for to run a "code with AI" workshop in my community. I wanted to add some translations since the people I want to show bolt to don't really understand English.

I am not super familiar with this tech stack, so I hope the structure of the code I added makes sense. Feel free to tweak it if it doesn't! 

I added Spanish and Catalan. If you are interested, I can also contribute with French. The project is very lightweight in terms of text, so it should be pretty easy for other members of the community to add more languages.

Note: I also had to tweak the prompt for "enhance prompt" because on top of enhancing, it was translating it into English. I think it should be harmless, but worth double-checking.

Note2: For the title and subtitle in the landing, I changed the copy to be the same you have in bolt.new. I think it's much better and probably it was not ported to this repo.
author: yoelcabo

comments.body:
Hey there 👋, thanks for your PR! This repo is intended as a foundational example of building an AI agent using the WebContainer API. While we appreciate the suggestion to add i18n, we'd prefer to keep this feature out of the scope for now. You're welcome to create a separate repo (with a link back to this one) to include additional features like i18n.

Thanks for understanding!
Makes sense! Thanks for your reply!

title: Netlify deployments
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe:**

I am running into a bunch of issues when trying to deploy to netlify. I cross reference my netlify dashboard and do not see this project in there (i am also not sure why i would?) I was never asked to sign into netlify or anything so that is weird.

**Describe the solution you'd like:**
Some kind of netlify integration with my Bolt account and netlify so they can talk to eachother. Espically when trying to publish to production.

**Describe alternatives you've considered:**

None at the moment, I am stuck on trying to deploy.

**Additional context:**
The chat often references a "netlify CLI" but i would not have known that unless I aksed.
author: JohnCarter09

comments.body:
Hi! 👋 Thanks for the comments!

You can publish to netlify anonymously, so you are still provided with a deployment URL. 

There's also a URL that allows you to 'claim' the page - which will allow you to manage it directly through your Netlify account.

Are you able to see these URLs when deploying?

In my case, I had to remind the LLM that it is able to deploy the project for me anonymously as you suggest @kirjavascript... using this prompt:
"The maintainers of bolt.new have commented in github issues that you should be able to deploy this project anonymously to netlify for me. Could you please try to do that? I am almost out of tokens for our session (29k left), so please limit text conversation with me as much as you can."
After that it successfully deployed and provided the URL as demonstrated in ViteConf.

Before that it was encouraging me to search my Stackblitz account for integration settings with my Netlify account, but also described how I'd manually deploy it through github/netlify.
Sidenote: This was the first time I could deploy an app through bolt.new with no extra features before running out of free-tier tokens, so I'd say you guys are making great progress 👍
This should now be resolved, thanks!

author: srinjoydutta

comments.body:
Hi! 👋 Thanks for the comments!

I agree, it would be great to have this feature! We're tracking this internally. We'll keep you posted ✨

+1, cmd + z is easy enough when your working on a single component, but when a major change happens and the AI overwrites 5-6 files and it ends up breaking, it can be hard to get back to where you were, even asking the AI to revert all of their changes sometimes you end up with a different UI

Maybe a short term solution would just be able to have a revert feature, where you can revert it to the state before your last prompt. Not perfect, but would be super helpful so you can decide what problems to fix.

Like if you ran a prompt and it came back with an error. Instead you could revert it back, specifically include in your prompt again to keep that error from happening, and then try again without losing your project history.

But versioning would be the best end goal!
Thank you for the great feedback! We completely agree and are working rapidly to implement this feature. The resolution will be tracked under #35!

title: <!-- Rest of the slides content remains the same --> should be ELIMINATED
body:
### Describe the bug

WHen AI responds with code, it should never respond with "<!-- Rest of the slides content remains the same -->" because this kills the code and the new result.

### Link to the Bolt URL that caused the error

general

### Steps to reproduce

create an initial app for example - see the result - ask for changes - if you're lucky, it will do "<!-- Rest of the slides content remains the same -->" and cut the code, resulting in losing alot of detail of course. The System Prompt should include: "NEVER respond with <!-- Rest of the slides content remains the same -->, but always write out the full code" something like this.

### Expected behavior

When asking for changes, AI should write out the full code, the new AND the old code, so it does not "dissapear". <!-- Rest of the slides content remains the same --> is unnacceptable and should be amended through the system prompt of Bolt.new

title: Can't understand pricing
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe:**

I got to a point where I see the message `24K of 150K daily tokens remaining.` Which makes me think I got 150k free daily tokens. 

I'm also invited to `Subscribe to Pro for 66x more usage.`. That would've been awesome, but the pricing tier says `Up to 500K output tokens per month`.

So I cannot clearly understand what get for free, and what do I get in the Pro tier. If it's 66 times more tokens, that would been around 10m tokens _per day_. But it says 500k _per month_ (which is like ~3 times the free daily quote, if I got the free daily idea correctly).

**Describe the solution you'd like:**

An easy to understand tokens quota - per day/month, or whatever the limitations are.

---

Despite that - it looks amazing! I am eager to test it a bit further (gimme those tokens 😈). Good job!

title: files are emptied after creation of the project
body:
### Describe the bug

when creating multiple files, contents of the files other than the last one created are emptied.

I thought the content was permanently removed, but fortunately "Ctrl+Z" undo this removal.

It is, however, very annoying and most people will assume it is a permanent deletion.

### Link to the Bolt URL that caused the error

do not matter

### Steps to reproduce

1- go to "bolt.new"
2- try a long prompt so it will create a multi-file project.
3- watch every file being created one by one
4- after the last file is written, open al other files to see them being empty.
and 
5- press undo to undo deleted file contents.

### Expected behavior

file contents are not deleted 

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Platform

- Windows 10 22H2 64bit up-to-date
- Edge 129.0.2792.65 (Official build) (64-bit) up-to-date

### Additional context

_No response_
author: yilmazdurmaz

comments.body: This issue was caused by a Remix React SSR Hydration mismatch, because a browser extension (or this browser itself) modified the dom. We've just shipped a fix, feel free to test and report back
